description: Enterprise techniques used by Kimsuky, ATT&CK group G0094 v1.0
name: Kimsuky (G0094)

techniques.comment: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used an email containing a link to a document that contained malicious macros.

techniques.techniqueName: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
techniques.comment: [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has exfiltrated data over its email C2 channel.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has created new services for persistence.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has gathered information about the infected computer.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has been observed disabling the system firewall and turning off Windows Security Center.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used Win7Elevate to inject malicious code into explorer.exe.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used RC4 encryption before exfil.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has placed scripts in the startup folder for persistence.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has deleted the exfiltrated data on disk after transmission.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has the ability to enumerate all the drives on an infected system.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has executed a variety of PowerShell scripts.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used a Google Chrome extension to steal passwords and cookies from their browsers.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has collected Office, PDF, and HWP documents from its victims.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used a Google Chrome extension to infect victims and steal passwords and cookies from their browsers.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used a modified TeamViewer client as a command and control channel.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used mshta to run malicious scripts on the system.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has a HWP document stealer module which changes the default program association in the registry to open HWP documents.
[Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094) has used emails containing Word, Excel and/or HWP (Hangul Word Processor) documents in their spearphishing campaigns.
